definition[0]: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 16 ounces or 0.454 kilograms
definition[1]: the standard unit of money in Britain, which is divided into 100 pence
example[3]: They spent over a thousand pounds.
definition[2]: the value of British money compared with the value of the money of other countries
example[6]: The pound was up against the dollar.
definition[3]: the standard unit of money in various other countries, such as Egypt and the Sudan
definition[4]: a place where dogs and cats that have been found on the street are kept until their owners come to get them
definition[5]: a place where cars that have been illegally parked are kept until their owners pay money to get them back
definition[7]: to hit something very hard several times and make a lot of noise, damage it, break it into smaller pieces etc
example[7]: He began pounding the keyboard of his computer.
example[8]: Thomas pounded on the door with his fist.
example[10]: Green pounded his fist on the counter.
definition[8]: if your heart or blood is pounding, your heart is beating very hard and quickly
example[11]: She ran, her heart pounding in her chest.
example[12]: Patrick rushed to the door, his heart pounding with excitement.
definition[9]: if your head is pounding, it feels painful, especially because you have a headache or you have been using a lot of effort
definition[10]: to walk or run quickly with heavy loud steps
example[14]: Runners will be pounding the pavement this weekend during the London Marathon.
example[15]: I could hear him pounding up the stairs.
definition[11]: to attack a place continuously for a long time with bombs
example[16]: Enemy forces have been pounding the city for over two months.
definition[12]: the standard unit of currency in Britain, which is divided into 100 pence
example[18]: a shortfall of millions of pounds
definition[13]: the value of the British currency compared with that of other countries
example[19]: The pound climbed strongly against the dollar.
definition[14]: the unit of currency in a number of countries, including Cyprus and Egypt
definition[15]: a unit of weight equal to 16 OUNCEs or 0.454 KILOGRAMs
example[20]: Apple prices averaged 24.9 cents a pound.
